title: [Self-Directed] Video-Based Lesson Design for Enhancing Middle School Mathematics Teacher Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Core secondary mathematics concepts and foundational teacher education knowledge
context.additional_context: A course where preservice secondary math teachers observe and analyze actual classroom situations via video to improve teaching skills, conducted in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Analyzing video recordings of students' problem-solving processes to derive at least three effective mathematics teaching strategies
Improving lesson design capabilities by over 20% using video-based feedback
Identifying middle school students' challenging math concepts with 80% accuracy and proposing personalized instructional plans

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
